Decision on Nitro-Liberty replacement Chrysler is near a decision on the replacement for the lightly regarded Dodge Nitro and Jeep Liberty SUVs, built at the company's Toledo North Assembly plant, Sergio Marchionne said. It's the most significant hole in our product portfolio, said Sergio Marchionne , referring to the mid-sized SUV segment. The Nitro and Liberty, which trail segment leaders such as the Honda CRV and Ford Escape, were among the few vehicles that were not revamped in the 2011

the year. The CEO said Chrysler remains on track to increase revenue from about$ 42 billion in 2010 to$ 67 billion in 2014, with operating profit growing to around$ 5 billion. From the bottom line, we expect to break even in 2011, increasing progressively to net profit of$ 3 billion by 2014, he told analysts this month at a conference in Detroit.
